info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 10:49AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ROAN AND TAVAPUTS PLATEAUS...FLAT TOPS...AND CENTRAL YAMPA RIVER BASIN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of 30 to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1048 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 11 miles east of Meeker to 33 miles east of Rangely and moving east at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Meeker and Buford. This includes the following highways... Colorado 13 between mile markers 31 and 49. Colorado 64 between mile markers 57 and 73. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
